Text:
Cid has become a student of Goldy Gilded to hide from
the "evil organization." He has now come to the forest
to receive training under him.

(I would've been fine with being his student in name
only, but if he's taking time out of his busy schedule
to train me, I guess I should take it seriously.)

Good, good... Seems you two have gotten the hang of
measuring Battle Power. Your calculations aren't too
shabby.

Skel, thanks to being self-taught, you seem pretty
familiar with the technique. Going forward, work on
speeding up your calculations and crunching more
numbers.
Understood! Thank you, Master Goldy!
As for you...umm...
It's Cid.

Right, Cid. You've got a sharp eye for details. With
proper training, you have the potential to yield
exciting results.
Thank you, Master Goldy.

From here on out, I'll delve into more advanced
teachings. As the protégés of moi, the Victorious
Golden Dragon Goldy Gilded, I expect both of you
to embody my essence.

So...I want you both to come up with your own
nicknames.

Nicknames?! You mean, like your "Victorious
Golden Dragon" title? We can call ourselves
something like that?!

Oh man, I'm getting all riled up! What should I go
with?!

I've got somewhere to be, so I'll ask for your
nicknames tomorrow. Consider it homework,
Skel and... um…
It's Cid.
Right, Cid. Now, if you'll excuse me.

(Come up with my nickname... Something about this
task excites me.)

("Red Comet," "Human Typhoon," "Spawn of Satan," or
something like that—)

Suddenly, a piercing pain shoots through Cid's head.
He winces and clutches his forehead, drawing a
concerned and puzzled look from Skel.
What's the matter, Cid?
...N-Nothing.

If you're drawing a blank, want me to come up with
something? Given your lack of presence, maybe...
It's fine. I'll think of something myself.

(What's this sensation? Have I done something like
this in the past? If so...)

Experiencing a sense of déjà vu from Goldy Gilded's
task, Cid decides to focus even more on his training,
hoping it might lead to recovering his lost memories.
A few days later...
Master Goldy, I'm back.
Back already?
Yes, I ran 100 laps from here to the forest entrance.
I see. Faster than I thought. Well done, um...
It's Cid.

Right, Cid. Sorry, I'm usually good with names...but
for some reason, I can't seem to remember yours.
By the way, where's Skel?

(Once Master Goldy mentioned 100 laps...Skel bolted
as soon as he was out of sight...)

...He remembered something urgent he had to do and
left. Anyway, what's next?

Well, as my protégé, you'll need to learn
swordsmanship. To build your strength,
start with 1,000 push-ups and sit-ups.
Understood.
Huh? You realize I said 1,000, right?

...Impressive. Without even a single complaint.
Not bad.

You've got potential. I get how serious you are about
this.

If you carefully follow and complete all my training
instructions...I'll teach you my Special Technique.
S-Special Technique?!
...Agh!
Once again, a sharp pain shoots through Cid's head.
Is something wrong?
N-No, it's nothing. I'd like to start immediately.
Alright, do your best, Ed.
It's Cid.
...Cid. Do your best.
(He never seems to remember my name, but...)

(Whenever I follow his instructions or think about
them, I get hit with this strange feeling.)

(Maybe Goldy Gilded holds the key to unlocking my
lost memories.)

When I look at you, it reminds me of my younger self.
Persistent, earnest...

...Did I shine as brightly as you in my youth?
My memory fails me now...
Master Goldy...

...Never mind that. This is where the real training
starts. Sure you want to learn my Special Technique?!
I do!!!
Alright, then follow me! Youth waits for no one!
Yes, sir!

First, give me 1000 push-ups facing that setting sun!
Think you're up for the challenge, Ed?!
It's Cid!

As the bond between master and student deepens, their
passionate exchanges continue on until nightfall...
...That concludes Nu's report.

Hearing Gamma's report, a palpable tension spreads
among the members in the room.
Master Shadow is learning swordsmanship?

The audacity to teach Master Shadow. Talk about
crossing the line.
(How did things end up like this...)

(My fear of information leaks has led to this
distrust.)

(He may have lost his memories, but for Cid to be
training under someone so inferior...)
I'll go fetch him myself.
What?! You're going yourself, Lady Alpha?!

If you leave it to me, I could easily handle the
likes of Goldy Gilded—
No, this is something I have to do.

(This is all because of my initial error in judgment.
It's my responsibility. That's why I have to retrieve
him myself.)

Alpha's eyes shine with determination. That night,
she departs from the ancient castle of Alexandria
alone, heading to reclaim Cid.
